title: How to know whether to use the present perfect simple or the past simple when speaking - Quora

response.answer_text: You use the simple past for something that occurred at a specific point in the past, e.g., He was here yesterday. You use the present perfect for (1) something that occurred at an indefinite time in the past, e.g., He’s been here before, or (2) for something that began in the past and is still going on, e.g., He’s been here since yesterday.
